page.title: 02The Ruthless Artery
page.content: The rise and fall of Tempsford has been caused by one main factor,transport.At one time the village could boast all means of transport.From bridges to barges roads and railways and an airfield.Today the A1 the main north to south artery dissects the village clean in two just like the old Roman road ,The Great North Road did prior to the building of the A1. There are two possible origins of the place name. Firstly prior to a sandstone bridge being built in 1736 there was a tempory ford in the area.Secondly, when the Danes invaded the area they took the river Ouse to be a tributary of the river Thames hence Thamesford which over the centuries resulted in{Tempsford.
